Creates a glossary and returns the long-running operation. Returns NOT_FOUND, if the project doesn't exist.

    <dd>{{% md %}}The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">

    </dt>

<h4 id="glossaryinputconfig">Glossary<wbr>Input<wbr>Config</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="gcssource_csharp">
<a href="#gcssource_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Gcs<wbr>Source</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#gcssource">Pulumi.<wbr>Google<wbr>Native.<wbr>Translate.<wbr>V3.<wbr>Inputs.<wbr>Gcs<wbr>Source</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats: For unidirectional glossaries: - TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names. - TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs. For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. See documentation for more information - [glossaries](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/glossary).{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="gcssource_go">
<a href="#gcssource_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Gcs<wbr>Source</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#gcssource">Gcs<wbr>Source</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats: For unidirectional glossaries: - TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names. - TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs. For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. See documentation for more information - [glossaries](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/glossary).{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>

<h4 id="languagecodepair">Language<wbr>Code<wbr>Pair</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="sourcelanguagecode_csharp">
<a href="#sourcelanguagecode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Source<wbr>Language<wbr>Code</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code of the input text, for example, "en-US". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="targetlanguagecode_csharp">
<a href="#targetlanguagecode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Target<wbr>Language<wbr>Code</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code for translation output, for example, "zh-CN". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

            title="Required">
        <span id="target_language_code_python">
<a href="#target_language_code_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">target_<wbr>language_<wbr>code</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code for translation output, for example, "zh-CN". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

<h4 id="languagecodesset">Language<wbr>Codes<wbr>Set</h4>

{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="languagecodes_csharp">
<a href="#languagecodes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Language<wbr>Codes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code(s) for terms defined in the glossary. All entries are unique. The list contains at least two entries. Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
